ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned several genetics lab techniques through first-hand experience and lots of independence. I now feel more comfortable working with yeast and flies, which I never worked with before.
Now this course was great. Learned some great wet lab techniques.
I was able to apply a lot of genetic concepts I had learned about in theory.
Basic genetic and biology laboratory practices, including petri dish streaking, Drosophila mating, and PCR and recombination.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths were our independence in lab and the breadth of the topics we covered. Weaknesses were the disorganization and rushed nature of the course.

This course was a great intro to wet lab techniques and genetic concepts for many students. It could be improved by perhaps being simpler? I know genetics are complicated but I would only start to understand the terminology and reasoning behind things during the second or third lab we did on the concept.

Professor Hartman is definitely the greatest strength of this course! I think this was the first year that it was taught by her after having been taught by the same professor for many years prior but the transition was seamless.
It was very poorly organized and did not follow the syllabus.

Strengths: Professor Hartman! She is such a wonderful professor and made this course so insightful and enjoyable. The pre-lab discussions and lab handouts were very helpful and set up necessary context. 

Weaknesses: At the beginning of the semester, it would have been helpful to a longer, more in-depth conversation about how to write a formal lab report, especially for students whose first lab class this is.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to someone wanting to take a biology lab at Yale. I think next semesters will get a better organized course than we did.

I would! The lab reports are different than gen chem (you build it yourself) which is a little bit of a challenge at first but you become very proud of yourself after the first couple. Also it was very fun to do fruit fly husbandry.
Yes! If you are looking for an MCDB lab, I would highly recommend.
no; too disorganized and unrealistic expectations with the lab reports
Yes, if you are looking for a lab class this is a great course.
